title: If Your Crappy Client Kicks Me Out Of Ranked Game Pre-Lobby
body: Then I should not lose LP and get a dodge queue timer. I dont know what the point of me downloading the new client was when it still bugsplats/freezes when people are banning champs.

It's not a typical type of "beta", it's a boards type of "beta".

Riot has said a number of times that work on the new client has been slow and hard, and part of that is that as long as the legacy client is still active they are actually doing double work since they have to update 2 live clients instead of just 1. Thus once the door is finally closed on the legacy client it's full steam ahead on giving the new client full focus.
In short making a new client is hard, and getting it running alongside the old client at the same time just means more work for everyone.
I don't look forward to using the new client myself (I've only used it a few times for arams and each time I never knew who I had going into a match until the loading screen), but I think we should hold off on verdicts for a while. If it took them a year to get this far, then I say give them till the end of 2017 and see how well this new ship is sailing. And if you REALLLLY don't like the new client, then sadly you have 2 options. Deal with it or just not play league until things are cleared.
They haven't updated anything after that in the Legacy client. Nearly no work done on that since no new features have been added ever since to the Legacy client.

ummm. they have put out the usual patches (on both clients) and kept putting out rotating game modes (some of which have been tweaked over the last few months since they needed said tweaks to work on the new client)

And since when is that any extra effort? Patches haven't done anything to the clients. You're saying shipping it to both clients takes extra effort? Maybe one extra button press at best. It's preset to send out to both clients most likely.

RGMs have been on Legacy before the New Client. There's nothing new on that in the Legacy client. If you read what i said, you'd notice that i'm saying the Legacy client hasn't received any special attention like some think it has.

Ummm. You realize in case they release a patch that changes in-game client (map and playing), they do very little work on out-game client (interface for account and starting game). So releasing a patch altering in-game client shouldn't take much time or effort on out-game.

Unless their code is really that bad, which wouldn't surprise me, most things affecting out-game client can be added as simple new files and simple new keywords and the rest should be handled by the core. Adding new skin into line of skins doesn't mean you actually create a brand new code, unless you fucked something up. Usually it needs to add new keyword into register and even some of that work may be done server-side.

As for RGM, most of the things yet again are parts of code already implemented, needing very little work plus most of the modes are already done and they are just being enabled and disabled. It really shouldn't take any work (yet again, unless they screwed up) to enable/disable access to certain queue and yet again, it can be done server-side, even needing no patch what so ever.
The new client has only been in beta for 5 months, not a full year. I'm pretty sure it hadn't even been put in alpha a year ago.
Now imagine Riot deciding to do a new engine to keep up visually.
The bad thing about it is that ignoring this important issue, they are already entering phases of forced update.

My client never crashes, so I read these posts and think "you probably have something wrong with your settings" or your machine has failing parts or buggy drivers. I'd look at the event log to see if you are having a memory issue or some other clue as to what's really going on might reveal itself.

Because if it isn't happening to you then it isn't a problem.  While I have not had this problem at all, I was experience the grayed out play button bug for a month or so.  My computer is new, my internet connection is stable and fast, I run Windows 10---which is unfortunate because it is a piece of garbage, but if everything else checks out the one common denominator is Riot's fancy new client.
Literally nobody I know has had any of these problems.  The closest thing we've had is the little bug when the accept button fails to pop up super quickly after the previous one failed.

Several of my friends, with different OS, different machines etc. and quite a few streamers I know had this problem way too many times.
I really don't know what Riot is doing with their clients. The client was the worst thing ever before and in the beginning of season 1, but the problems with the client have mostly stayed the same for almost 6 years. There's not a single game or client I know that is as unstable as the Riot's clients. It really feels like they just have 10 chimps sitting in room, working on the client.

I can totally understand when there are problems and bugs, but not if they stay the same for several years, especially when it's about the biggest and most played pc game ever.
It's not even like these are special problems with uncommon pc setups, internet settings etc., but they are very common and are part of way too many players daily gaming experience.

Let me chime in with me getting dc'ed in the loading screen.(there's a white box that appears that says that you have been disconnected) I have to log out of the desktop, and then log back into both the desktop(or windows or w/e) and the client.

My computer runs everything at ulta settings 60 fps, 16 GB RAM, i7-6700 CPU @ 4.00 GHZ, 120 GB SSD, 1 TB HardDrive. I have never had any problems with any game crashing except for League, I dont know why.
